intro: Pachira rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed pachira, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody, upright stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing seeds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. Pachira rufescens is also valued for its resilience and adaptability to both indoor and outdoor environments.
